{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "CAD Engineer",
  "description": "MAR &amp; MOR is a building services company that is passionate about customer satisfaction, best practices and standards compliance. We provide semi-last mile services to improve nearly every aspect of your mechanical and electrical installations. We Design, Procure, install and maintain Heating,Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) systems, water treatment, Firefighting and water supply systems as well as power supply, electrical network and communication systems to meet industrial, commercial or residential requirements. We also provide quality general plumbing services.

Established in 2008, MAR &amp; MOR continues to grow, with a strong reputation for delivering high quality, fully integrated electrical and mechanical installations.&nbsp;Over the years, we have gained outstanding experience delivering quality service to a wide range of discerning clients, gathering a considerable knowledge base working on projects, with a solid team of engineers and technicians with an average of 10 years experiential practice - committed to providing products and services of the highest quality. Today, we offer these resources and experience to help you lower maintenance and repair cost; reduce downtime and improve productivity; increase operating efficiency and achieve a better return on assets

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: CAD Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	Do you excel in Electrical design and drafting? MAR &amp; MOR is seeking a CAD Engineer to craft accurate and efficient Electrical designs for MEP projects, ensuring compliance with industry standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Create detailed Electrical drawings
	Collaborate with mechanical, plumbing, and firefighting teams to integrate MEP layouts.
	Prepare and maintain technical documentation, shop drawings, and as-built drawings.
	Ensure designs comply with standards (e.g., ASHRAE, SMACNA, local codes).
	Provide site support during construction and resolve on-site design issues.
	Use AutoCAD, Revit, and BIM tools for project designs.


Qualifications


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Electrical Engineering with 7+ years of experience as a CAD Engineer in an MEP contracting environment.
	Proficiency in AutoCAD, Revit, and industry-standard tools.
	Strong knowledge of MEPF systems (HVAC, piping, plumbing).
	Exceptional attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief Cover Letter to:&nbsp;recruitment@marandmor.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note:&nbsp;Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.",
  "datePosted": "2025-12-03",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-11",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Mar & Mor Integrated Services Limited"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "191262"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



CAD Engineer Job at Mar & Mor Integrated Services Limited




        
    

        
        MAR & MOR is a building services company that is passionate about customer satisfaction, best practices and standards compliance. We provide semi-last mile services to improve nearly every aspect of your mechanical and electrical installations. We Design, Procure, install and maintain Heating,Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) systems, water treatment, Firefighting and water supply systems as well as power supply, electrical network and communication systems to meet industrial, commercial or residential requirements. We also provide quality general plumbing services.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Established in 2008, MAR & MOR continues to grow, with a strong reputation for delivering high quality, fully integrated electrical and mechanical installations. Over the years, we have gained outstanding experience delivering quality service to a wide range of discerning clients, gathering a considerable knowledge base working on projects, with a solid team of engineers and technicians with an average of 10 years experiential practice - committed to providing products and services of the highest quality. Today, we offer these resources and experience to help you lower maintenance and repair cost; reduce downtime and improve productivity; increase operating efficiency and achieve a better return on assets

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: CAD Engineer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	Do you excel in Electrical design and drafting? MAR & MOR is seeking a CAD Engineer to craft accurate and efficient Electrical designs for MEP projects, ensuring compliance with industry standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Create detailed Electrical drawings
	Collaborate with mechanical, plumbing, and firefighting teams to integrate MEP layouts.
	Prepare and maintain technical documentation, shop drawings, and as-built drawings.
	Ensure designs comply with standards (e.g., ASHRAE, SMACNA, local codes).
	Provide site support during construction and resolve on-site design issues.
	Use AutoCAD, Revit, and BIM tools for project designs.


Qualifications


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering with 7+ years of experience as a CAD Engineer in an MEP contracting environment.
	Proficiency in AutoCAD, Revit, and industry-standard tools.
	Strong knowledge of MEPF systems (HVAC, piping, plumbing).
	Exceptional attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief Cover Letter to: recruitment@marandmor.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Logistics Officer",
  "description": "Eco Fleet Services -&nbsp;We are a forward-thinking Nigerian transport and logistics company committed to providing sustainable, reliable, and efficient mobility solutions. Our focus is on fleet management, haulage, and CNG-powered transport services, helping clients cut costs while embracing cleaner energy alternatives.

With expertise in driver management, vehicle maintenance, road safety, and eco-friendly logistics, we ensure smooth and safe movement of goods and people across Nigeria. Guided by innovation, sustainability, and customer satisfaction, we are shaping the future of green transport solutions in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Calabar, Cross River
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Logistics Officer will coordinate and manage all logistics, driver supervision, trip monitoring, documentation, and operational reporting at Lafarge Mfamosing, ensuring efficiency and adherence to client requirements.


Key Responsibilities


	Supervise daily driver deployments, trip allocations, and return schedules.
	Liaise with Lafarge plant authorities to process trip codes, loading instructions, and weighbridge documentation.
	Monitor drivers&rsquo; conduct, compliance with safety rules, and timely escalation of incidents.
	Ensure prompt resolution of operational issues, truck breakdowns, accidents, and client complaints.
	Track fleet movement using GPS/telemetry tools and prepare daily reports.
	Verify waybills, loading slips, delivery receipts, and other documentation.
	Support technical teams in coordinating repairs and maintenance.
	Work closely with HR/Admin to enforce discipline among assigned drivers.
	Maintain strong relationship with client representatives.


Requirements


	BSc/HND in Business Admin, Logistics, Transport Management or related field.
	3-5 years of experience in logistics or transport operations.
	Strong supervisory skills.
	Familiarity with Lafarge operations is an added advantage.
	Strong communication and problem-solving skills.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 per month.&nbsp;

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to:&nbsp;hr.ecofleetservices@yahoo.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.&nbsp;",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-20",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Eco Fleet Services"
    
  },

    }

  },

Logistics Officer Job at Eco Fleet Services




        
    

        
        Eco Fleet Services - We are a forward-thinking Nigerian transport and logistics company committed to providing sustainable, reliable, and efficient mobility solutions. Our focus is on fleet management, haulage, and CNG-powered transport services, helping clients cut costs while embracing cleaner energy alternatives.

With expertise in driver management, vehicle maintenance, road safety, and eco-friendly logistics, we ensure smooth and safe movement of goods and people across Nigeria. Guided by innovation, sustainability, and customer satisfaction, we are shaping the future of green transport solutions in Africa.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Officer
Job Location: Calabar, Cross River
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Logistics Officer will coordinate and manage all logistics, driver supervision, trip monitoring, documentation, and operational reporting at Lafarge Mfamosing, ensuring efficiency and adherence to client requirements.


Key Responsibilities


	Supervise daily driver deployments, trip allocations, and return schedules.
	Liaise with Lafarge plant authorities to process trip codes, loading instructions, and weighbridge documentation.
	Monitor drivers’ conduct, compliance with safety rules, and timely escalation of incidents.
	Ensure prompt resolution of operational issues, truck breakdowns, accidents, and client complaints.
	Track fleet movement using GPS/telemetry tools and prepare daily reports.
	Verify waybills, loading slips, delivery receipts, and other documentation.
	Support technical teams in coordinating repairs and maintenance.
	Work closely with HR/Admin to enforce discipline among assigned drivers.
	Maintain strong relationship with client representatives.


Requirements


	BSc/HND in Business Admin, Logistics, Transport Management or related field.
	3-5 years of experience in logistics or transport operations.
	Strong supervisory skills.
	Familiarity with Lafarge operations is an added advantage.
	Strong communication and problem-solving skills.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: hr.ecofleetservices@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.     

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Network Engineer",
  "description": "Layer3 is one of the fastest growing network and security infrastructure companies in West Africa, providing award-winning services, including managed and cloud services, network security, IT infrastructure management, virtualization and mobile device management solutions. Our unique model integrates best-of-breed technologies from global leaders such as Juniper Networks, Blue Coat, Polycom, AirWatch, F5, Extreme Networks and VMware, coupled with our next-generation metro fiber networks, to offer unparalleled services and after sales support to some of the most demanding customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Senior Network Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)

Job Summary


	Senior Network Engineer will also be responsible for planning, directing and coordinating activities required to fulfil and support network services to enterprise customers. These include the management of existing and development of new network infrastructure systems, as well as managing system and network administration.


Job Responsibilities


	Extensive hands-on engineering level support on switching and routing technologies such as BGP, OSPF, MPLS/VPLS, spanning tree protocols e.g.; MSTP, RSTP, 802.1x, 802.11, 802.16, VPN, DMVPN, SDN, VRRP/HSRP, WAN Acceleration, QoS, VoIP, VTC, cloud, Automation and similar network technologies.
	Ability to analyze and troubleshoot network communications failures and bottlenecks.
	Ability to analyze system logs, identifying potential issues and troubleshooting any reported network problems
	Switching tasks include VTP, ISL/ 802.1q, IPSec and GRE Tunneling, VLANs, Ether Channel, Trunking, Port Security, STP and RSTP.
	Configuration of LAN/WAN/WLAN links using VSI/ L2VC, for MPLS L2VPN will be required to be available for on-call duties on a need basis.
	Understands and assist in technical strategies in the design, configuration and maintenance of LAN, WAN and wireless networks to ensure the stability, integrity and operational effectiveness and efficiency of network services.
	Participates in the design and configuration of internal and/or external networks as required for assigned projects.
	Supervise IP/MPLS services&rsquo; implementation covering the installations, testing &amp; handover.
	Proactively perform corrective maintenance for IP/MPLS network.
	Develop automation and other internal systems and tools to assist in the care and feeding of the IP/MPLS network and integration activities.
	Responsible for network planning, configuration, and implementation.
	Design and develop routing topology for Core /Access/Metro/Edge network infrastructures and for converged data &amp; communications services and their successful integration.
	Drive Digital Transformation Agenda using Cloud, Security, Big-Data, IOT, SDN, SDS, SDWAN, and SDWAN
	Responding to RFQ &amp; preparing proposals.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Information Technology or related field or its equivalent.
	Minimum of 6 years of relevant experience in troubleshooting and managing IP networks.
	Hands on experience in Cisco, Juniper, Fortigate, Bluecoat is required.
	A thorough understanding of network technology and protocols.
	Operating systems knowledge.
	Advanced knowledge in cabling structured network.
	Possess high level interpersonal communication skills.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their Applications to:&nbsp;careers@layer3.com.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Interview Process and&nbsp;Notice


	Our interview process at Layer3 is a multi-stage process. This process is designed to for us to know you better and how well you fit into the Layer3 culture. We are eager to meet you.
	Only qualified candidates would be contacted.

Senior Network Engineer Job at Layer3




        
    

        
        Layer3 is one of the fastest growing network and security infrastructure companies in West Africa, providing award-winning services, including managed and cloud services, network security, IT infrastructure management, virtualization and mobile device management solutions. Our unique model integrates best-of-breed technologies from global leaders such as Juniper Networks, Blue Coat, Polycom, AirWatch, F5, Extreme Networks and VMware, coupled with our next-generation metro fiber networks, to offer unparalleled services and after sales support to some of the most demanding customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Network Engineer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Summary


	Senior Network Engineer will also be responsible for planning, directing and coordinating activities required to fulfil and support network services to enterprise customers. These include the management of existing and development of new network infrastructure systems, as well as managing system and network administration.


Job Responsibilities


	Extensive hands-on engineering level support on switching and routing technologies such as BGP, OSPF, MPLS/VPLS, spanning tree protocols e.g.; MSTP, RSTP, 802.1x, 802.11, 802.16, VPN, DMVPN, SDN, VRRP/HSRP, WAN Acceleration, QoS, VoIP, VTC, cloud, Automation and similar network technologies.
	Ability to analyze and troubleshoot network communications failures and bottlenecks.
	Ability to analyze system logs, identifying potential issues and troubleshooting any reported network problems
	Switching tasks include VTP, ISL/ 802.1q, IPSec and GRE Tunneling, VLANs, Ether Channel, Trunking, Port Security, STP and RSTP.
	Configuration of LAN/WAN/WLAN links using VSI/ L2VC, for MPLS L2VPN will be required to be available for on-call duties on a need basis.
	Understands and assist in technical strategies in the design, configuration and maintenance of LAN, WAN and wireless networks to ensure the stability, integrity and operational effectiveness and efficiency of network services.
	Participates in the design and configuration of internal and/or external networks as required for assigned projects.
	Supervise IP/MPLS services’ implementation covering the installations, testing & handover.
	Proactively perform corrective maintenance for IP/MPLS network.
	Develop automation and other internal systems and tools to assist in the care and feeding of the IP/MPLS network and integration activities.
	Responsible for network planning, configuration, and implementation.
	Design and develop routing topology for Core /Access/Metro/Edge network infrastructures and for converged data & communications services and their successful integration.
	Drive Digital Transformation Agenda using Cloud, Security, Big-Data, IOT, SDN, SDS, SDWAN, and SDWAN
	Responding to RFQ & preparing proposals.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Information Technology or related field or its equivalent.
	Minimum of 6 years of relevant experience in troubleshooting and managing IP networks.
	Hands on experience in Cisco, Juniper, Fortigate, Bluecoat is required.
	A thorough understanding of network technology and protocols.
	Operating systems knowledge.
	Advanced knowledge in cabling structured network.
	Possess high level interpersonal communication skills.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their Applications to: careers@layer3.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Interview Process and Notice


	Our interview process at Layer3 is a multi-stage process. This process is designed to for us to know you better and how well you fit into the Layer3 culture. We are eager to meet you.
	Only qualified candidates would be contacted.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

As a Finance Services since its advent operation, the organization has maintained its leadership role by deepening this alternative model of financing. This has laid the foundation for providing the needed ethical funding for individuals, businesses and government in the areas of projects, trade finance, general finances and infrastructural development in the country.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Officer / Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki-Ajah, Abraham Adesanya - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	A university Degree, preferably in Human Resources Management.
	At least 3 years of hands-on experience in payroll management (fintech experience is a plus).
	Strong interpersonal, communication, leadership, and management skills.
	Ability to articulate the advantages of an ideal payroll process.
	Supporting the People Operations Lead in delivering people solutions, standardising, and improving processes.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV / Resume&nbsp;to:&nbsp;careers@d-arshcapital.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

HR Officer / Manager Job at D-Arsh Capital Limited




        
    

        
        D-Arsh Capital Limited, is a financial institutions in Nigeria and is poised to providing ethical services to individuals, corporate, and government entities.

As a Finance Services since its advent operation, the organization has maintained its leadership role by deepening this alternative model of financing. This has laid the foundation for providing the needed ethical funding for individuals, businesses and government in the areas of projects, trade finance, general finances and infrastructural development in the country.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Officer / Manager

Job Location: Lekki-Ajah, Abraham Adesanya - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Requirements


	A university Degree, preferably in Human Resources Management.
	At least 3 years of hands-on experience in payroll management (fintech experience is a plus).
	Strong interpersonal, communication, leadership, and management skills.
	Ability to articulate the advantages of an ideal payroll process.
	Supporting the People Operations Lead in delivering people solutions, standardising, and improving processes.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV / Resume to: careers@d-arshcapital.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Please don`t apply if you dont reside in Lagos.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
